skills.title: HTML5
skills.description: [HTML5](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HTML5) is a markup language used for structuring and presenting content on the World Wide Web. It is the fifth and final major HTML version that is a World Wide Web Consortium recommendation.

skills.title: CSS3
skills.description: [Cascading Style Sheets](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CSS) is a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML

skills.title: JavaScript
skills.description: [JavaScript](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript), often abbreviated JS, is a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS

skills.title: React-Native
skills.description: [React Native](https://reactnative.dev/) combines the best parts of native development with React, a best-in-class JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

skills.title: NodeJS
skills.description: [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/en/) is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser

skills.title: React
skills.description: [React](https://reactjs.org/) is a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library for building user interfaces based on UI components.
